info.author: Hans Meine
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
info.description:
This module offers an easy way to define named constants in Python,
supporting some simple enum-like use case, as well as arbitrary value
types like strings or floats.  It is rather simple to use and does not
have a big footprint, but supports the following features:

* Ease of use (a simple class for scoping, plain definitions inside)
* Enumeration of defined constants
* Values know their *name*, i.e. you don't have to guess which meaning
  the constant value 3 has (e.g. it's name() will be 'blue' and its
  __repr__ will format as 'Colors.blue')
* Arbitrary value types (not just integers)
* Constant-ness (no change after time of definition)
info.name: named_constants
info.summary: This module offers an easy way to define named constants in Python, supporting some simple enum-like use case, as well as arbitrary value types like strings or floats.
info.html_description:
This module offers an easy way to define named constants in Python, supporting some simple enum-like use case, as well as arbitrary value types like strings or floats. It is rather simple to use and does not have a big footprint, but supports the following features:

  • Ease of use (a simple class for scoping, plain definitions inside)
  • Enumeration of defined constants
  • Values know their name, i.e. you don’t have to guess which meaning the constant value 3 has (e.g. it’s name() will be ‘blue’ and its __repr__ will format as ‘Colors.blue’)
  • Arbitrary value types (not just integers)
  • Constant-ness (no change after time of definition)
